content.content: Key Info Name: mhonkasalo & teemulau Delegate Address: 0xaa19f47e6acb02df88efa9f023f2a38412069902 Forum: @mhonkasalo & @teemulau Discord: mhonkasalo#3692 & teemulau#7395  Delegate Statement  About us  We are long-time crypto investors who have participated in and followed the DeFi ecosystem for years. Today, we are working together on protocol research and governance efforts. Many of you may know @mhonkasalo on Twitter. I was previously on the research team at The Block and on the investment team for ParaFi Capital. @teemulau has experience organizing one of the largest tech events globally, Slush, and working in finance & ops positions in startups. We are long-term MKR holders and have been part of the community for years.   Our values and initiatives  Helping MakerDAO craft a growth strategy Market downturns are the best time for fundamentally strong protocols like MakerDAO to capture market share and grow against the wind. First, we view the future of DAI as increasingly B2B instead of B2C (which most crypto protocols are today). In the crypto context, this means DAO-to-DAO. MakerDAO can become the wholesale lender for all of DeFi who distributes DAI through their channels – we are seeing the first steps of this with the Aave, Compound TrueFi, and Maple D3M modules. We recognize the ongoing discussion relating to fundraising and want to take an active role in assisting with the process. If there’s a fundraise, in no scenario should it dilute MKR holders. There should be a clear data-driven cost/benefit analysis on the need for a capital raise. The lack of excitement and engagement from outside of the Maker community is a large problem. Reasons for this need to be discussed, including the idea of bringing more utility to the MKR token. As an example, stkMKR proposed by monetsupply would bring a more enticing token economic model with arguably no downside to the project. Even if this is not the priority today, it’s clear that an update is required and would improve the system. A buy-and-burn mechanism is good — especially when prices are low leading to more MKR being burned — but stkMKR would offer better reward targeting, security, and potentially a stronger narrative.  Supporting a scalable DAO model A key reason we are doing this is that Maker governance needs more active delegates with enough weight to have an impact on the overall results and to drive new initiatives that don’t necessarily originate from Maker core team members. Voter apathy is a huge issue. At one of the governance meetings, it was reported that 2 entities had 90% of the active voting power. Hasu has pointed out that MakerDAO suffers from the principal-agent problem. Core Units aren’t always aligned with the interests of MKR holders. Establishing trust between MKR holders and the Core Units is key going forward. The Core Units are often doing a great job but even then, MKR holders aren’t finding out about it. The relationship between MKR holders and Core Units shouldn’t be adversarial – in fact, it should be the opposite. Maker is currently unprofitable. This doesn’t necessarily mean that resources should be cut, but now is a good opportunity for further analysis and ensure that goals to help Maker scale are being prioritized correctly. The current market environment highlights the need for financial discipline – now and in the future. We want to help get Maker ready for growth when the opportunity arises. This means scalable processes and using Maker’s inherent advantages to drive demand — such as low-interest rates to outcompete others.  Conflicts of Interest  We don’t have any investments or incentives that should impact our role as a delegate at the current time. MKR has been one of our core holdings for a long time. We consider ourselves very strongly aligned with the long-term success of the project. We have also read, and agree with, the Recognised Delegate Code of Conduct.
content.GPT-summary: The post is an explanation of the Mhonkasalo & teemulau Delegate Platform, which is a proposal for MakerDAO. The authors are long-time crypto investors who want to help MakerDAO grow and become more profitable. They propose a growth strategy for MakerDAO, which includes becoming a wholesale lender for all of DeFi and supporting a scalable DAO model. They also address conflicts of interest and align themselves with the long-term success of the project. The post includes constructive criticism and invites collaboration and questions.

3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Voting decisions and arguments Polls: Deploy a Trial Permissionless Open Market Operation - June 13, 2022 - No, as Maker is not currently profitable and given the current market environment, it does not make sense to spend resources on burning MKR right now. Management of Velodrome Airdrop and veNFT - June 13, 2022 - Yes, to improve DAI liquidity on Optimism. Velodrome is a solid project and compared to efforts this is a net positive. Add rETH as a new Vault Type - June 13, 2022 - No, right now Rocketpool and rETH wouldn’t contribute significant revenue to the protocol and resources are better spent elsewhere. This could mean that rETH can be voted in at a later time. Exec votes: Temporarily Disable the Aave DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M) - June 15, 2022 -  Supported. From a risk management point of view, a lot of DAI is theoretically at risk. We recognize the other side of the discussion, namely what kind of relationship Maker wants to have with Aave, highlighted by @MakerMan and others. Still, considering the market turmoil, it is better to play it safe right now and continue to manage the good relationships with Aave.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Voting decisions and arguments Polls: Community Greenlight Poll - KREDIKA (Kredika LTD) - June 6, 2022 - No, despite the professional application and comprehensive background documentation, we view the risk levels too high compared to the estimated yield (around 2%). Community Greenlight Poll - XSGD (StraitsX) - June 6, 2022  - No, due to concerns over quality of collateral.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Voting decisions and arguments Polls: Ratification Poll for Task Forces (MIP75) - June 13, 2022 - No, It is unclear to us what is the need for an additional governance structure outside of Core Units. We believe Maker should simplify its governance processes rather than creating additional layers. Cross-CU work should be encouraged and be possible within the existing CU budget framework. If the real necessity of Task Forces as a new governance structure is demonstrated better, we are open to reforming our opinion. Ratification Poll for Onboard Growth Task Force (MIP75c3-SP1) - June 13, 2022 - No, for the reasons above. Growth initiatives are important and should be pursued within the existing budgets. Ratification Poll for Facilitator Onboarding to IS-001 - @psychonaut (MIP41c4-SP34) - June 13, 2022 - Abstain. We do not have enough knowledge of the person to make a fair informed decision, considering the vote being controversial. Ratification Poll for Facilitator Onboarding to DIN-001 - @tadeo (MIP41c4-SP35) - June 13, 2022 - Yes, based on the overwhelmingly positive response from other delegates and large MKR holders. Ratification Poll for Adding Lending Oversight Core Unit (LOVE-001) - June 13, 2022 - Yes, we have discussed with various people including @luca_pro himself and are convinced of his professionalism and expect positive future contributions to Maker. The proposed unit is essentially an oversight audit function, which we see beneficial for the DAO. Ratification Poll for Adding a Special Purpose Fund - Makershire Hathaway (MIP55c3-SP4) - June 13, 2022 - Yes, generating yield on DAI should be a long-term priority and we believe this proposal is a solid first step in testing out these strategies. We look forward to evaluating each of the strategies separately. Ratification Poll for MIP16 Amendments (MIP4c2-SP20) - June 13, 2022 - Yes, the motivation for the changes are clearly defined and we do not see any downsides to the decision. Ratification Poll for Permissionless Open Market Operations (MIP74) - June 13, 2022 - Yes, we see this is as a useful technical piece of infrastructure which keeps options open in the future, as argued by @LongForWisdom. Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Strategic Finance Core Unit Budget, SF-001 (MIP40c3-SP69) - June 13, 2022 - Approve existing budget only (business as usual). The Strategic Finance CU is important to the operations of Maker, but at this point, only few budget increases should go through if seen absolutely critical. Ratification Poll for Onboard/Amend Keep3r Network (MIP63c4-SP4) - June 13, 2022 - Abstain, we are not deep enough in understanding the Keep3r system to make an informed decision. Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Growth Core Unit Budget, GRO-001 (MIP40c3-SP70) - June 13, 2022 - Approve increased budget (BearMarket). A slight increase in budget is justified for growth, since there is currently a unique opportunity to gain market share for DAI. Exec votes:  MKR Vesting Transfers - June 22, 2022 -  Supported. There is nothing controversial in the proposal in our view.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Voting decisions and arguments Polls: Prioritization Sentiment - Technical Resource Deployment - June 6, 2022   Compound D3M   Maker Teleport   Term Lending Module   We view the D3M’s critical for Maker’s growth. Additionally, Maker Teleport will support DAI’s L2 growth. The TLM enables a native fixed-rate lending market by integrating with Yield Protocol. Prioritization Sentiment - Collateral Class - June 6, 2022   Peg Stability Solutions   Broader Market Demand-Based Solutions   Real-World Asset Vaults   One of Maker’s current key challenges is its reliance on USDC as collateral. Diversifying this concentration with alternative solutions should be high in the priority list. Additionally, we view other D3M’s like Aave’s important for Maker’s growth together with onboarding Real World Assets. Maker should onboard the correct RWAs that 1) have quantifiable risks 2) lucrative enough in terms of yield 3) overall clarity to onboard with reasonable time investment. It seems like Core Crypto Collateral is the overwhelming favourite among votes but the focus would be much on BTC & ETH derivatives as written in the forum post. We view 2&3 more important to focus on than “the long tail of crypto collateral”. Exec votes: Core Unit MKR Transfer and Advancing Collateral Offboardings - June 29, 2022  -  Supported. There is nothing controversial in the proposal in our view.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Polls: Add RWA-009 (HVBank) as a new Vault Type - July 4, 2022 - Yes, we see this as an important & perhaps the most notable RWA initiative so far in Maker’s history. PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - July 4, 2022 - Yes, the suggested parameter changes make sense given the current market environment, contagion risks, and yield from LPing. Select a Target Level of rNPI Profitability to Guide Budget Cuts - July 4, 2022 - Break-even (Plus-minus 5%). In the end, this is a game of survival. We would rather be slightly more conservative than risk-taking in the current environment. Also, CUs have large unspent budgets, as pointed out by AES from the Strategic Finance CU. They should participate in the cost cuts by spending less from their existing budgets.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Voting decisions and arguments Polls: Ratification Poll for Governance Facilitator Onboarding GOV-001 (MIP41c4-SP37) - July 11, 2022 - Yes, Patrick J. has a great record working with MakerDAO according to all attestations from people who have previously worked with him. Exec votes: Core Unit Distributions, Recognized Delegate Compensation, Keeper Network Stream Setup - July 06, 2022 -  Supported. There is nothing controversial in the proposal in our view. MOMC Parameter Changes - July 13, 2022 -  Supported. The adjustments recommended in the MOMC are sensible from a risk management perspective.

Voting decisions and arguments Polls: Community Greenlight Poll - bIBTA (Backed Finance Short-Term Bond ETF) - July 18, 2022 - Yes, this proposal has received endorsements from the Strategic Finance Core Unit. Strategically, it makes sense to allocate to US treasuries via multiple service providers to distribute risk. The assets are custodied and managed under Swiss law. Maker effectively has billions of USDC on the balance sheet doing nothing, which has been widely discussed in the community. Diversifying USDC to exposure to short-term bonds has been one of the widely agreed core short-term goals. As long as counterparty risk is well-managed, proposals like this make sense.

Voting decisions and arguments Exec votes: Onboarding Real World Asset Vaults - July 29, 2022 -  Supported. We support the OFH and HVBank RWA initiatives. Onboarding assets outside of native crypto tokens is important to Maker’s long-term growth.

Voting decisions and arguments Polls: PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - August 1, 2022 - Yes, the reasoning given for the parameter changes is clearly written by @monet-supply and we have no reason to object to these changes. Maker Teleport Deployment on Starknet and Associated Risk Parameters - August 1, 2022 - Yes, we support this necessary step for Maker Teleport deployment on Starknet. Starknet is one of the most promising L2 technologies and Maker needs to be at the forefront of pushing DAI there. Tactical Re-allocation Process for Budget Adjustments - August 1, 2022 - Yes, we are voting in line with our view of the corresponding signal request. While broad budget cuts allow for speed, it is unsustainable if CU performance is not somehow tied to budgets and performance. The Tactical Reallocation choice can be time-consuming but the long-term benefits outweigh the time investment.

Voting decisions and arguments Exec votes: HVBank Drawdown, Keeper Network Stream Re-Deployment - August 03, 2022    Supported. We’ve consistently supported RWA opportunities for MakerDAO and will continue to do so in the future, provided the counterparties are well vetted and risk is well understood.

Voting decisions and arguments Polls: MIP9 Community Greenlight Poll - Pando (Pando Investment Grade Climate Assets) - August 1, 2022 - No, with the current issues in the RWF Core Unit yet to be resolved, there are some questions about moving forwards with this RWA proposal. Additionally, we don’t consider the proposed collateral high quality enough to be worth the risk at this time. Better focus on collateral types such as bonds that can provide better risk-adjusted returns for now.

Voting decisions and arguments Polls: Ratification Poll for Modify Dai Foundation Core Unit Budget (MIP40c3-SP74) - August 8, 2022 - Super Bear Scenario, The Dai Foundation serves an important purpose, but in our view, the suggested budget cut in the Super Bear Scenario allows for key operations to stay intact while staying financially responsible. Ratification Poll for Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments (MIP4c2-SP15) - August 8, 2022 - Yes, a process that is simpler to offboard CUs has been needed and this proposal is a good step towards accomplishing that. The aim is to reduce harm to the DAO and community in the event of CU disruptions. Historically, the offboarding process hasn’t been clear enough and we support the clarifications of the process. Ratification Poll for Modify Oracle Core Unit Budget (MIP40c3-SP75) - August 8, 2022 - Approve proposed budget (Reduced budget exempt from further cuts for 12 months), it’s great that in the proposed budget the Oracle CU is proactively suggesting cutting their expenses by 10%. Given the importance of oracles for the security and development of Maker, this is a CU that’s important to keep well-resourced. Ratification Poll for MIP50 Direct Deposit Module Amendment (MIP4c2-SP23) - August 8, 2022 - Yes, we support expanding the D3M module from lending protocols to a more generalized version. Ratification Poll for Makershire Redux (MIP76) - August 8, 2022 - Yes, adding DAI liquidity on L2s is extremely important for the competitiveness of Maker. This is a good use of Maker protocol-owned DAI, and we’d like to see these efforts expanded. The goal should be to replace USDC as the primary trading pair on L2s. We consider this as an important piece in DAI expansion and growth. Ratification Poll for Offboarding Events Core Unit (EVENTS-001) - August 8, 2022 - No, we want to keep the events CU, but expect financial responsibility. Events are a small and important factor in the big picture, and off-boarding this CU doesn’t really solve anything long-term. When looking at budget cuts, we should be focusing on large capital inefficient structures that can be trimmed down. Exec votes: MOMC Parameter Changes, SocGen Vault Drawdown Authorization, Recognized Delegate Compensation, HVBank Legal Agreement Amendment - August 12, 2022 -  Supported. Excited to see the stETH stability fee vault at 0% to encourage borrowing – this should be pushed out via marketing channels heavily. We’d support more aggressive lower rates across all vaults as well. It is disappointing to see the HVBank deal frozen. Maker should create organizational structures that minimize the risk of this happening in the future.

Voting decisions and arguments Polls: Maker Teleport Deployment on Starknet and Associated Risk Parameters - August 15, 2022 - Yes, Starknet is one of the most promising L2 technologies and having DAI there is critical.

Voting decisions and arguments Polls: Community Greenlight Poll - RWA Arranger (BlockTower Credit) - August 15, 2022 - Yes, BlockTower is a reputable company that has significant long term interests in the success of MKR. Considering the risk-reward (with the proposed 4% fixed yield), we are greenlighting this.  Community Greenlight Poll - Cabot (Cabot Renewable Energy Crypto Mining LLC) - August 15, 2022 - No, at this time, it makes sense to prioritize only the highest return RWF activities and focus should be on UST yields. We don’t want the existing pipeline to become overburdened and this RWA effort can be considered again in the future. Community Greenlight Poll - DDC (Detox Digital Coin) - August 15, 2022 - No, we don’t see this effort as the best risk-reward effort in RWF given the current situation and that the existing pipeline should focus on USTs. This is something we’d be happy to visit later down the line.

Voting decisions and arguments Polls: Collateral Onboarding Project-based Funding Request (PFR) - August 22, 2022 - Yes, given the current situation with RWF, we think it’s good to allocate more resources to ensure that the collateral onboarding continues in a professional fashion. Target Spend Level - August 22, 2022 - 15 million DAI, the uncertainty continues in the crypto and macro markets. We’d rather be financially conservative at this point and play the long game of survival.

Voting decisions and arguments Exec votes: HVBank (RWA-009) Drawdown - August 24, 2022 -  Supported. We support the ongoing RWA process with HVBank. The separate $25M tranches help to decrease counterparty risks & optimise the conversion of DAI to USD (considering market liquidity).

Voting decisions and arguments Polls: PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - August 29, 2022 - Option 2, we support aggressively lowering rates to increase the demand to borrow. This also has the side effect of lowering the reliance on USDC collateral, but our primary goal with these changes is to increase competitiveness. Especially in bull markets, undercutting rates should be used more as a strategy – this is something to keep in mind if/when the market turns. This will be a powerful growth tool for Maker going forward when combined with revenue from bonds. Ratification Poll for Legal Domain Work on Greenlit Collateral (bIBTA) Special Purpose Fund (MIP55c3-SP6) - August 29, 2022 - Yes, we previously voted to get Backed Finance onboarded and are willing to commit resources to the legal due diligence here.
Exec votes: HVBank Drawdown, Maker Teleport Launch on Optimism and Arbitrum - August 31, 2022    Supported. We support the ongoing RWA process with HVBank and the efforts to expand DAI to L2s.

Polls: Short Ratification Poll for Legal Work on MIP65 Special Purpose Fund (MIP55c3-SP8) - September 5, 2022 - Yes, MIP65 efforts are crucial for Maker to improve its revenue profile and Christian’s legal work needs to be done ASAP. Short Ratification Poll for MIP65 Amendments (MIP4c3-SP4) - September 5, 2022 - Yes, given the current status of RWF-001, this looks like the correct option to proceed with MIP65 efforts. MKR Pro-Rata Vesting for former RWF-001 Members - September 5, 2022 - Yes, the RWF-001 have produced substantive results with RWA efforts in MakerDAO and deserve their compensation. The situation has been controversial and determining the RWF employees to be bad leavers is too harsh. We are struggling to understand the other side of the argument here. Updating HVBank (RWA-009) Legal Agreements - September 5, 2022 - Yes, straightforward legal agreement updates. Community Greenlight Poll - GUNIV3-BUSD-DAI (Gelato Uniswap v3 BUSD-DAI) - September 5, 2022 - Yes, BUSD is a large stablecoin with demand. Gelato Uni v3 stablecoin pools have created notable demand for DAI and increased supply historically. We should continue onboarding these types of collateral. Community Greenlight Poll - GAMMA UNI-V3-WBTC-RENBTC (Gamma Uniswap v3 wBTC-renBTC) - September 5, 2022 - No, we don’t see enough demand right now for WBTC-RENBTC Uniswap V3 collateral to be onboarded. We view the lack of demand for the renBTC vault in Maker as an important data point here.

Hey thanks for the feedback @teemulau and @mhonkasalo ! Yeah that’s feedback that a few others have mentioned as well. I would say the biggest indicator for demand for the collateral is the yield potential via multiplied leverage.  That is determined by how much DEX volume is currently being generated by this token pair as the yield potential will determine how much liquidity is attracted to the pool. There’s a lot of upward potential to go in the Uniswap v3 pool before the yields start to dwindle down. Historically, there’s been around $3M in volume per day in the Uniswap renBTC-WBTC pool. And there’s been around $5M per day in the Curve pools. That’s a total of $8M in aggregate volume. On 100M TVL, that’s $4,000 in fees generated per day, which is around 1.46% APR without applying any leverage.  Currently the GUNI-V3-DAI-USDC pool is generating around 0.6% APR at the moment and has reached a maximal TVL of around $1B. It’s also important to look at general renBTC volume on Curve and Uniswap, not necessarily the strict renBTC to WBTC trade. Curve.fi/renbtc trading volume. When there’s a lot more renBTC/WBTC liquidity on Uniswap, we can expect a lot of general renBTC trade volume to get routed thru Uniswap if let’s say they’re trading from renBTC to ETH. A lot of that trade volume will hit the renBTC-WBTC pool because the route would go renBTC <> WBTC <> ETH. Price impact is already low on the WBTC to ETH leg of the trade on Uniswap, so when you lower the renBTC to WBTC price impact, you’ll also get a material amount of volume allocated there on DEX aggregators. I’ve also been in talks with some hedge funds and institutions that are looking to make a delta neutral play where they have multiplied exposure to this pair, and shorting the same exposure on a perpetual futures exchange. So, I think the overall demand for this collateral is not necessarily going to be driven by the current renBTC demand on MakerDAO, but moreso, the yield potential from the renBTC <> WBTC trade on Uniswap. Hope that helps!  I know you guys are delegates on Uniswap as well, so happy to talk thru this over the phone in more detail if that makes sense. Thanks again for the feedback!
Exec votes: Core Unit MKR Vesting, Recognized Delegate Compensation, MOMC Parameter Changes - September 07, 2022    Supported. Straightforward compensation approvals and parameter changes.

Polls: Ratification Poll for Amend Measurement Period For Delegate Participation Metrics (MIP4c2-SP24) - September 12, 2022 - Yes, it’s better to place emphasis on the currently active delegates in compensation. A 120-day rolling window is a sufficient period to accomplish measuring the participation of delegates. Ratification Poll for the MakerDAO Delegates MIP Set - September 12, 2022 - Abstain, vested MKR aligns delegates better with the long-term success of the DAO. As communicated previously on the forums, we believe in abstaining from delegate compensation size-related votes. Ratification Poll for MKR Compensation for StarkNet Engineering Core Unit, SNE-001 (MIP40c3-SP79) - September 12, 2022 - Yes, MKR incentives for the StarkNet CU retroactively have been earned. Getting half from Starkware aligns a MakerDAO CU with one of the most promising L2s. The size of the incentives seems right relative to the compensation of other CUs. Ratification Poll for Special Purpose Fund for The Ambassador Program (MIP55c3-SP7) - September 12, 2022 - Yes, a good grassroots movement for a fair price. Also, the social media reach metrics are high enough to warrant the continuation of the Ambassador Program. Ratification Poll for Modify GovAlpha Core Unit MKR Budget (MIP40c3-SP80) - September 12, 2022 - 100% multiplier (165.14 total MKR), 77 MKR/FTE is in our view an appropriate boost to compensate the GovAlpha CU and align them with the success of MakerDAO. Ratification Poll for Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001) Offboarding (MIP39c3-SP2) - September 12, 2022 - Abstain, we don’t view the SH-001 offboarding as a high-priority or high-impact issue. Given that other delegates have more history with the SHCU than us, we’ll abstain from this vote and let them decide.

Polls: Community Greenlight Poll - RFA (RFA - Canadian Federally Regulated Mortgage Originator) - September 19, 2022 - Yes, based on the available information and support from Centrifuge (among others), it makes sense to greenlight this initiative for further investigation.

Polls: Collateral Auction Parameter Updates - September 26, 2022 - Yes, the suggested proposals by the Risk CU to the auction mechanism can increase auction throughput, and in turn, decrease the market risk of liquidatable collateral. Update rETH Onboarding Parameters - September 26, 2022 - Yes, liquid staking derivatives offer an attractive collateral type for Maker, and right now we favor stETH and Lido over other options. It is good to see rETH being brought on, despite a lack of liquidity at the current moment. The proposed decrease in Stability Fee by 0.75%, from 2.25% to 1.5% (and other parameter changes) encourages more borrowing with rETH, which is good.

Polls PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - October 3, 2022  [YES] We agree with the proposed change to lower the stability fee on the Curve ETH/stETH vault. This makes it more competitive.  Approve Multisig for Management of Velodrome NFT - October 3, 2022  [YES] This proposal makes DAI more competitive on Optimism by directing emissions to e.g. the USDC/DAI pool. DAI liquidity on L2s is a high priority.  Community Greenlight Poll - ANCHORAGE (Anchorage Lending Crypto Mining) - October 3, 2022  [NO] We don’t view loans to crypto-mining operators secured by ASIC machines as a high priority or attractive risk-reward opportunity.

Exec vote Monetalis Clydesdale (RWA007-A) Onboarding, Funding Ambassador Program SPF, Core Unit MKR Streams and Transfers - October 5, 2022  Supported. Monetalis is a good step for Maker to improve its revenue profile. We hope to see more of these efforts succeed – e.g. Coinbase deal in the next governance cycle.

Polls: Whitelist Oasis.app on rETHUSD Oracle (MIP10c9-SP31) - October 10, 2022 - Yes, we don’t see a reason to deny Oasis.app access to the rETHUSD Maker oracle. Change PSM-GUSD-A Parameters - October 10, 2022 - Yes, this increases Maker’s revenue and diversifies the collateral base away from USDC – both of which are good steps forward. We are happy with stablecoin providers stepping up to bring yield to Maker. End DAI Funding For Sourcecred - October 10, 2022 - Yes, we haven’t seen positive results from using Sourcecred and support the initiative to stop its funding. MOMC Guidance - Remove ETH Supply Yield And Liquidity Incentives From D3M Target Borrow Rate Calculations - October 10, 2022 - Yes, we support the reactivation of D3M and this proposal makes Maker once again a competitive option for usage on Aave. MOMC Guidance - Allowed Spread Between D3M Target Borrow Rate And ETH-A Stability Fee October 10, 2022 - Option 1, as Maker looks to restart the D3M, the 0.5% option that implies 90m DAI exposure and 680k in revenue looks reasonable to us.

Polls: Ratification Poll for Monetalis-Coinbase Appaloosa (MIP82) - October 10, 2022 - Yes, we will support this deal but would like to point out that custom BTC/ETH backed vaults to centralized counterparties like this bring on additional risks that we should be thoughtful about in the future. Coinbase is probably one of the few entities globally where this type of deal structure is justifiable from Maker’s perspective, with high enough stability fees (4 - 6%) to compensate for the custom structure.

Polls: Ratification Poll for Endgame Prelaunch MIP Set - October 10, 2022 - Yes, We are voting yes for the endgame pre-launch MIP set. For the upcoming votes related to the endgame, we will decide on an individual basis based on the merits of the specific MIP. In our opinion, there are many questions around the viability of e.g. the token economics proposed between MakerDAO and the MetaDAOs. It’s positive that the  LDO <> MKR swap was removed from this MIP set. This MIP set can be beneficial to Maker. However, it also sets up open questions in the future. The main ones to be worried about are (i) poorly designed dilution of MKR holders, and (ii) setting up the removal of the DAI-USD peg. For MKR inflation, the current plan of 50k annual MKR inflation goes into supporting MetaDAOs in exchange for MetaDAO tokens. This equals investing ~$50m annually with these (low) MKR prices. We don’t want MKR holders to be diluted even in the slightest at the benefit of new (MetaDAO) token holders where the ownership structure is questionable. Right now, at least to us, it’s unclear what is the exact process of how the MetaDAO tokens are distributed.

Polls: MIP65 Asset Reallocation - October 24, 2022 -   Yes, the reasons for the reallocation are clearly given in the forum post and make sense.  Exec votes: rETH Technical Onboarding, Enable Starknet DAI Bridge Fees - October 26, 2022    Supported. We see no reason to not support this exec.

Polls Activate Liquidations for Stablecoin Vaults to Clear Bad Debt - October 31, 2022  YES We support clearing legacy debt from the protocol before the Endgame launch.  One Month Budget Extension for Strategic Happiness Core Unit - October 31, 2022  NO We don’t see a reason to extend the budget by one month for the SHCU.  PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - October 31, 2022  YES It is great to see the Compound D3M coming online. We strongly believe that Maker’s future is as a wholesale lender to other protocols that can scale the DAI supply.

Exec Budget Stream Housekeeping For Offboarded Core Units, Oracle Whitelist Addition, SPF Funding - November 02, 2022  Supported. We supported the core unit offboardings with their final outgoing payments, and the legal work required for Blocktower to move forward with RWA efforts.

Polls Add the Compound V2 DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M) - November 7, 2022  Yes. We strongly believe that Maker’s future is as a wholesale lender to other protocols that can scale the DAI supply. Compound is a trustworthy lending protocol to expand the D3M efforts into.

EXEC Maker Teleport Technical Deployment on StarkNet, Recognized Delegate Compensation Distribution for October, MOMC Parameter Changes - November 9, 2022  Supported. Maker Teleport is a good step in bringing DAI multi-chain and our belief is that zk-rollups are a promising method of scaling Ethereum.
EXEC Urgent Collateral Parameter Changes - November 12, 2022  Supported. These parameters changes makes sense to us given the liquidity constraints in the market for lower cap tokens.
Polls: Stablecoin Vault Liquidation Parameters and Auction Activation - November 14, 2022 - Yes, we are aligned with the analysis of the risk core team with regard to clearing the bad debt.

Exec votes: Parameter Changes for RWA-007-A (Monetalis Clydesdale), Enable rETH-A DC-IAM, Housekeeping Changes - November 16, 2022    Supported.  We support the RWA efforts and the expansions of the staked ETH collateral base (with rETH) as outlined in this executive proposal.

Polls: Add GNO (GnosisDAO) as a new Vault Type - November 21, 2022 - No, it is difficult for Maker to provide GNO vaults since liquidity could become a real issue even with low proposed debt ceilings. For large token holders, it makes sense to borrow against their holdings, but Maker as a counterparty would risk similar issues as e.g. Genesis. Offboarding Parameters for renBTC-A - November 21, 2022 - Yes, given the connection to Alameda Research with this project, we think it is prudent to remove it as a collateral from Maker. Also, it seems like BTC deposits are closed to obtain new renBTC.

Add Multiple BlockTower Credit Vault Types (RWA010, RWA011, RWA012, RWA013) - November 21, 2022   Yes, BlockTower has been a trustworthy operator and this MIP diversifies Makers efforts on that front. BlockTower is well aligned with the success of MakerDAO given their sizeable MKR holdings.  Proceed with Pre-Implementation Work for the Deal Outlined in MIP90 (BlockTower Liquid AAA Structured Credit and Money Market Fund) - November 21, 2022   Yes, we continue to support the efforts by BlockTower on the RWA front.  Ratification Poll for Immunefi Security Core Unit (IS-001) Facilitator Onboarding (MIP41c4-SP38) - November 14, 2022   No, we don’t see major a difference between this proposal and the previous failed onboarding attempt. We defer to the arguments of others who are more familiar with the facilitator in question.  Ratification Poll for OUSD Decentralized Rewards (MIP87) - November 14, 2022   No, we consider the OUSD rewards program to be too risky for Maker to take on. We believe that we should be extremely considerate when interacting with other service providers. With Maker working with various providers to get yield for Maker USDC PSM, the market will test how many of these efforts will be allowed through.
mhonkasalo:  too risky for Maker to take on   Hi mhonkasalo, could you be more specific here?

Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Development and UX Core Unit (DUX-001) Budget (MIP40c3-SP82) - November 14, 2022  Approve reduced budget - NewBase. This is the one thing Maker should continue investing in – top-tier engineering talent. With revenue coming from e.g. Coinbase soon, we are more comfortable extending a budget higher than the lowest suggested.  Ratification Poll for CoinShares Active Treasury Management (MIP86) - November 14, 2022  No. Based on the amounts already allocated to Coinbase and Monetalis, Maker is better off not increasing its counterparty risk more at this time. Additionally, enough capital has been allocated from the PSM from now.  Ratification Poll for Modify Immunefi Security Core Unit (IS-001) Mandate (MIP39c2-SP38) - November 14, 2022  No. We’d like to see more information on why this CU is indispensable to Maker. We believe ISCU is better off as its own revenue-generating entity in the ecosystem.  Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Immunefi Security (IS-001) Budget (MIP40c3-SP83) - November 14, 2022  Reject budget. See comments on the ratification poll on the Immunefi Security Core Unit Mandate.  Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Governance Communications Core Unit DAI Budget, COM-001 (MIP40c3-SP84) - November 14, 2022  Approve Budget. The budget requested is reasonable considering the role of COM-001.  Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit DAI Budget, SAS-001 (MIP40c3-SP85) - November 14, 2022  Reject Budget. At the current moment, we don’t see the SAS-001 as crucial to the operations of Maker. We would like to see more information on why this CU is needed.  Budget Ratification Poll for Modify TechOps Core Unit DAI Budget, TECH-001 (MIP40c3-SP86) - November 14, 2022  Approve budget. TechOps performs functions that we believe are crucial to Maker and the proposed budget is in line with the results they’ve produced in the past.  Ratification Poll for Modify Emulated Surplus Buffer Upper Limit (MIP84c10-SP1) - November 14, 2022  No. We previously voted for the Endgame Plan with the plan to cap the surplus buffer at a lower number to invest in ETH. At current ETH prices, we believe this is a reasonable risk for Maker to take but would like to exercise caution with similar decisions in the future.  Ratification Poll for Monetalis - Redwood Friesian (MIP88) - November 14, 2022  Yes. Residential mortgage-backed investments are riskier than treasury yield investments, and we believe Maker needs to have better RWA monitoring going forward. However, we support this proposal.  Ratification Poll for Monetalis - Arrow Andalusian (MIP89) - November 14, 2022  Yes. We approve investing in Blackrock/iShares ETF products to increase earnings and reduce reliance on Circle/Coinbase. However, it’s worth pointing out that Maker needs better RWA monitoring tools to asses risk and this is something Monetalis needs to provide.  Budget Ratification Poll for Modify the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling Core Unit DAI Budget, SES-001 (MIP40c3-SP87) - November 14, 2022  Approve speedy operations platform option budget. SES provides an important function to Maker and the proposed budget reduction makes sense in our opinion.

DAI Savings Rate Adjustment - November 28, 2022 - Increase the DSR to 1%. It’s time to go on the offensive with growth strategies, and the incoming RWA payments from Monetalis are more than enough to cover DSR payments. In terms of risk, it would be important to have a larger surplus buffer, but since the Monetalis efforts are voted in we now have to trust they will continue making payments. PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - November 28, 2022 - Yes. We don’t see anything wrong with the risk limitations taken with the proposed parameter changes. Undertake Necessary Risk and Legal Assessments to Increase the NS-DROP Debt Ceiling to 50 Million DAI - November 28, 2022 - Yes. We should be evaluating the proposal to increase the NS-DROP debt ceiling – even if we decide later not to undertake said increase.

EXEC Compound D3M Onboarding, Activating Stablecoin Liquidations, Oracle Feed Whitelisting, Starknet Relay Upgrade, and MKR Vesting - December 2, 2022  Supported. In particular, we are excited to have the Compound D3M onboarded, as this pushes forward the vision of Maker being a lender for other protocols.

EXEC Recognized Delegate Compensation, GNO Onboarding, BlockTower Credit RWA Vaults Onboarding, renBTC Offboarding, MKR Vesting, MOMC Parameter Changes, DAI Savings Rate Adjustment, Starknet Bridge Parameter Changes - December 09, 2022    Supported. BlockTower’s RWA onboarding is another good step in the RWA program, though we are concerned about the risks of adding new service providers from here on out. We are very much in favor of aggressive growth strategies. Particularly because the revenue profile of Maker is improving rapidly from RWF revenue, initiatives such as increasing the DSR are important. We’d also like to see more aggressiveness on lower stability fee rates.

Polls Change of Ownership of the Ambassador’s Program Multi-Sig - December 12, 2022  Yes. We support Sebix moving into this role officially as he has been filling in for the role for the past 2 months already.  Dai Foundation Board Member Election Poll - December 12, 2022  Abstain. We are less familiar with the candidates in this case and will allow others with more information to make this decision.  Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit (SAS-001) Funding Request - December 12, 2022  Yes. The request is reasonable considering the new objective of becoming a trusted custom software development service provider for MetaDAOs.  Governance Communications Core Unit (COM-001) Funding Request - December 12, 2022  Yes. We did not reject the previous budget proposal from COM-001 and support giving them an extra month’s worth of budget to complete the offboarding process.  Ratification Poll for Pioneer DeFi-focused Language Dataset for the Benefit of Risk Modelling & Governance Communication (MIP55c3-SP11) - December 12, 2022  No. We don’t see the benefit of applying LLMs to social sentiment analysis. Overall, this proposal is written in a very hand-wavey way without a clear value-add to Maker. We are highly skeptical of the efficacy of the models that would be built.

Approve One-time MKR Distribution to Correct CES-001 Incentive Program Shortfall - January 9, 2023 - Yes, there’s no reason not to fix the already earned MKR distributions to CES contributors. Confirm Trial Deployment of DssKiln - January 9, 2023 - Burn 0.5 million DAI worth of MKR, we don’t view burning MKR at this point as a high priority. But, burning a nominal amount to test out DssKiln while also showing the community that the burn still exists is not harmful. PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - January 9, 2023 - Yes, we support increasing the debt limits on the Compound and Aave D3M modules. In this case, we slightly disagree with the stability fee increase on the stETH vault and would like to see those kept at 0%. However, the changes here are still worth passing. Ratification Poll for MIP63 Maker Keeper Network Amendment (MIP4c2-SP31) - January 9, 2023 - Yes, we have reviewed the pull request and agree with the clarification to make the payment stream 6 months. Ratification Poll for Defense Fund (MIP55c3-SP14) - January 9, 2023 - No, we don’t believe there’s a need to set up an insurance fund of 5M DAI for defense purposes. This proposal does not define clearly what it is required for qualification and seems to create overhead/complexity that did not previously exist. We believe it is better to separately apply for a legal grant if someone in the DAO runs into trouble. Ratification Poll for Onboard PSM USDC to Yearn to earn Yield (MIP92) - January 9, 2023 Yes, Yearn is the best name in DeFi for generating yield in our opinion as the smart contracts have been battle-tested. It is true that DeFi yields right now aren’t extremely competitive, but this should change if the market turns and at that point, it would have been good to already set Maker up to take advantage. Ratification Poll for Declaration of Intent to Develop a Comprehensive On-chain Monitoring Solution for RWA Vaults (MIP13c3-SP13) - January 9, 2023 - Yes, we have previously warned of the need for better RWA monitoring and consider this an extremely urgent matter to be fixed. Ratification Poll for Onboard-Amend Keeper Network - Chainlink Automation (MIP63c4-SP5) - January 9, 2023 - Yes, onboarding Chainlink to the Maker’s Keeper network is a no-brainer and we think they’ve shown good proactivity running this pro-bono for a test period. Ratification Poll for Remove MIP14c4 (Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling) (MIP4c2-SP32) - January 9, 2023 - Yes, we expect an increase in SPF requests and see no reason to force Maker to keep the limit at 250k DAI. Ratification Poll for Obsolete MIP Removal (MIP23, MIP28) (MIP4c4-SP3) - January 9, 2023 - Yes, the proposals are obsolete and can be removed from the MIP portal view. Ratification Poll for Amend MIP51 to Remove MIP51c4 (Calendar Exceptions) (MIP4c2-SP28) - January 9, 2023 - Yes, there’s no need for a calendar holiday in the governance process – Maker should have enough redundancy and active participants to be able to make decisions whenever. This is also what separates us from traditional finance. Ratification Poll for Amend MIP61 to tighten up Recognized Delegate Participation Metrics (MIP4c2-SP29) - January 9, 2023  - Approve both, we believe both changes make sense. Abstaining should be allowed but the 60% threshold recommended here is reasonable. For security purposes, it’s important for executives to be voted on within 72 hours.

teemulau:  Ratification Poll for Remove MIP14c4 (Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling) (MIP4c2-SP32) - January 9, 2023 - Yes, we expect an increase in SPF requests and see no reason to force Maker to keep the limit at 250k DAI.   You’ve voted to remove MIP14 ceiling, giving the reason of “we expect an increase in SPF requests”. But then you also vote to get rid of MIP14?     teemulau:  Ratification Poll for MIP14 Repeal (MIP4c4-SP2) - January 9, 2023 - Yes, this MIP has never been utilized.   There are 2 MIP14 proposals up for polling in this cycle. And as you say, probably will be a further increase going into this year.

@simonkp thanks for pointing this out we got our MIPs mixed up here momentarily. Error has now been fixed. Ratification Poll for MIP14 Repeal (MIP4c4-SP2) - January 9, 2023   No. This MIP is being used in the current governance cycle.

EXEC Core Unit Budget Streams, MKR Vesting, Recognized Delegate Compensation - January 11, 2023  Supporting the mainly compensation-related executive.  POLLS Ratification Poll for Commercial Risk and Legal Domain Work to Support SF-001 Expanded Mandate Related to RWAs (MIP55c3-SP12) - January 9, 2023  Yes. Since Maker has taken the approach to onboard RWAs, it’s crucial to invest in the process of seeing them through and analyzing them thoroughly.  Ratification Poll for Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund IS-001 from Dec 2022 to May 2023 (MIP14c2-SP2) - January 9, 2023  Yes. We support funding IS-001 until May under the current framework and then having them switch to an Endgame Cluster.  Ratification Poll for Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to fund TechOps CU for February 2023 (MIP14c2-SP1) - January 9, 2023  Yes. We approve the bridge funds to TechOps CU. This seems appropriate to sustain critical infrastructure.  Ratification Poll for Core Unit Offboarding (COM-001) (MIP39c3-SP7) - January 9, 2023  Approve Offboarding, 60,700 DAI Golden Parachute and 100% Multiplier for retroactive MKR - additional 107,317.50 DAI (CU-preferred). COM-001 has done a good job for Maker in the past. Arguably, they would have gotten good MKR compensation packages had they asked for this last year with other CUs, and now the situation is quite difficult because there’s no incentive for the DAO to give that payout. In the end, we agreed that the medium golden parachute option is the fair one given the work done here.

Ratification Poll for Special Purpose Fund for developing Proof-of-Performance for Viridian Cluster (MIP55c3-SP13) - January 9, 2023  No. The requested amount seems excessive for a small and short-term project. We are unsure that MakerDAO should be funding an Endgame Cluster to do the task of RWA monitoring at this point.

Decrease GUSD PSM Fee Out (tout) - January 16, 2023 - Yes. Comments bundled for these two polls below. Adjust the GUSD PSM Debt Ceiling - January 16, 2023 - No change (500 million DAI). Our main concern is the overwhelming majority of GUSD supply inorganically being in the PSM (~85%). This shows there’s no organic demand outside of Maker PSM, unfortunately. For example, by comparison, the percentage of USDC supply in PSM is a few percent. Balancing the good reputation and regulatory standing of Gemini (to date), the revenue being generated for Maker, and the existential risk GUSD presents to Maker is difficult. It’s possible to argue that the Gemini Earn situation should not impact GUSD and no material facts have changed since the GUSD PSM debt ceiling increase was approved. Even if Maker decides to instead lower the debt ceiling (to 100m or 0), the challenge here is that it does nothing except stop the generation of more DAI with GUSD – but does not create a market force to unwind the position. Therefore we’re voting to keep the debt ceiling at the current levels. Lowering the GUSD PSM tout to 0% shouldn’t have any significant effect in the short term either. At the same time, this might slightly reduce the supply long-term, so we’re voting to lower the tout to 0%. If Maker wants to unwind the GUSD risk, the question remains how to properly do that? The only possible solution seems to be implementing a market incentive (e.g. negative tout?) to encourage an unwinding process. This would create a higher impact poll.

Offboarding Parameters for USDC-A, USDP-A, and GUSD-A - January 23, 2023  Yes We don’t see a reason why old USDC-A, USDP-A, and GUSD-A vaults can’t be removed.  Adjust the Debt Floor (dust) - January 23, 2023  Option 2 - Limited Reduction. We think it’s OK to lower the Dust parameter slightly lower, but would be worried about users getting “stuck” in vaults during high gas periods. From this floor, you’d expect gas only to increase. The real solution, if smaller vaults are wanted, is an L2 deployment.

EXEC MOMC Parameter Changes, GUSD PSM tout Decrease, CES MKR Transfer, Flash Mint Module Upgrade, Cage Aave D3M - January 27, 2023  Supported. We are happy to see the new Aave D3M deployment moving forward. We voted for the GUSD PSM tout reduction in the polling but don’t believe it will have a big impact. The risks need to be considered at the time they are taken and Maker shouldn’t be seen as an unreliable business partner by panicking and moving out of these deals.

Short Ratification Poll for Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund Endgame Information Portal (MIP14c2-SP3) - January 30, 2023 - Yes. Any reasonable efforts to bring more clarity to the Endgame process, external or internal to Maker, should be encouraged.

Maker Teleport Temporary Shutdown, DAI Transfers, Starknet Contract Deauthorizations - February 3, 2023  Supported. We support the SPF funding for the SF Core Unit to build out real-world assets and think this is important to keep going while the Endgame migration is happening.

Update the Multisig Managing the Velodrome NFT - January 6, 2023  - Yes, we support a change to the multi-sig to accommodate MakerMan leaving and others entering. PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - February 6, 2023 - Yes, we are particularly excited about the increases and changes related to the D3M modules. Most rates are being lowered here, which we agree with, though it would be nice to see stETH vaults decreased as well.

EXEC Dust Parameter Changes, Chainlink Automation Keeper Network Stream Setup, Recognized Delegate Compensation for January - February 8, 2023  Supported. We voted for lowering the dust floor for vaults and authorizing payments to Chainlink for their Keeper setup.

Ratification Poll for Restart a daily $100 Micro-Burn of MKR in Show of Good Faith to MKR Holders (MIP74c1-SP1) - February 13, 2023 - No, We don’t believe in the signaling value of burning negligible amounts of MKR. Long-term Maker should either burn a lot of MKR, issue significant “DAI dividends” to MKR holders (staked Maker), or use profits to include risky assets (like staked ETH) to its treasury. The most important thing is that Maker has a healthy PnL, growing DAI supply, and growing profit margins (with sufficient decentralization and keeping the DAI dollar peg). Maker needs to focus on how to grow the next 10x from here and not focus on incremental signaling tricks. The market price of MKR ultimately depends on Maker’s ability to generate cash flow, and the market’s expectation of future cash flows. This cash flow can then be distributed to holders in various above mentioned ways (like burning a lot of MKR).

Polls Ratification Poll - Declaration of Intent - Implement a Feature to Refund People who Lost Money Sending Dai to the Dai Contract Address (MIP13c3-SP14) - February 13, 2023  Yes. People have lost money due to the UX issues in crypto, this seems to be important to at least one party and there looks to be enough enthusiasm by Maker community members to get this idea over the finish line. We understand it requires a bit of work and might not be the best reward but it’s a positive signal to users.  Ratification Poll for Amend Interim Facilitator Appointment Process (MIP4c2-SP30) - February 13, 2023  Yes. We support improving the resolution speed and flexibility of these Interim Facilitator processes.  Ratification Poll for Amend MIP62 to Allow for Changing Communication Responsibilities (MIP4c2-SP33) - February 13, 2023  Yes. We support replacing GovComms as the responsible party for communicating offboarding through MIP62.

Engineering Resource for Phoenix Labs - February 20, 2023 -Yes. Audit and Review Work for Phoenix Labs - February 20, 2023 -Yes. Comment bundled for the two above: We support this initial resource allocation from PECU to Phoenix Labs. However, it is somewhat likely that these resource needs grow, as Spark Protocol (hopefully) grows. If so, there should be further discussions and votes about the situation. Hexonaut has written the following: “Spark Protocol is being developed by Phoenix Labs but is wholly owned by Maker Governance. This includes all smart contracts, trademarks, IP, etc. Phoenix Labs expects to merge Spark Protocol into a Maker SubDAO when they become available. As part of the Endgame plan, multiple competitive SubDAOs are being formed next year with associated tokens that are linked to cash-flows from the SubDAO products. Revenue generated from Spark Protocol will go to these token holders.” There needs to be a clear understanding of how much work, if any, is done at MKR holders’ expense on the basis of mutual benefit between Maker and any future SubDAOs. Here, it seems that the future Spark SubDAO token launch will be completely fair and Maker Governance owns the project. So we’re voting yes on this. These ownership details are something we are watching closely for any upcoming SubDAO and will adjust our future votes accordingly.

POLL: Ratification Poll for $100M of Cogent Bank Loan Participations (MIP95) - February 13, 2023 - Yes. This is a high-quality RWA deal that we think is a sensible next step for the entire program. If this one doesn’t go through, it’s unlikely that future ones will and we support keeping the pipeline open. We are concerned about Maker’s ability to deliver on these initiatives given the Endgame transition – but we hope that adequate resources are allocated to this. EXEC: Aave v2 D3M Deployment, Strategic Finance MKR Vesting Streams, and MOMC Parameter Changes - February 22, 2023 - Supported, We strongly support Aave D3M deployment and wish to see Maker push many initiatives in the future to grow DAI in DeFi (such as with Phoenix Labs).

PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - February 27, 2023 - Yes. Among the proposed changes, we view the rETH debt ceiling increase as the most consequential and one that will drive demand for DAI. We also are encouraged by the D3M adoption and moving up those maximums.

POLLS Decrease the RETH-A Dust Parameter - March 6, 2023  Yes. The analysis looks clear to us and a 7,500 DAI dust parameter for RETH is acceptable.  Short Ratification Poll for Phoenix Labs Initial Funding (MIP55c3-SP15) - March 6, 2023  Yes. We are happy to support Phoenix Labs’ initial efforts as previously stated in a similar poll and will consider our future votes based on the sizes of the resource requests, in combination with the results of the project.  EXEC CRVV1ETHSTETH-A Liquidation Parameter Changes, Stablecoin Vault Offboarding, MOMC Parameter Changes, Budget Distributions, Recognized Delegate Compensation for February - March 8, 2023  Supported. We agree with changing the CRVV!ETHSTETH-A liquidation parameter to limit the risk Maker has from the single large counterparty. Also, we have previously voted for the MOMC parameter changes during polling.

EXEC Emergency Parameter Changes - March 11, 2023  Supported. We supported the emergency parameter changes to deal with the unusual USDC position. Overall, these risks will exist if Maker has an RWA asset strategy (which we support) and the best solution is to simple continue to manage risks well.

EXEC Emergency PSM Changes - March 14, 2023 -Supported, we support the ability to set PSM debt ceilings to zero without the GSM delay. POLLS Remove the DC-IAM from MIP65 (RWA007-A) - March 13, 2023 - Yes, we support the capability to deploy into treasuries quicker. Increase the MIP65 (RWA007-A) Debt Ceiling - March 13, 2023 - Yes, we support the increase in the debt ceiling. Short Ratification Poll for Vault Setting Amendment Subproposal (MIP92c5-SP1) - March 13, 2023 - No, the size of a 3 million DAI allocation into these strategies compared to the operational investment isn’t meaningful at this time. Return Excess MIP65 Funds to Surplus Buffer - March 13, 2023 - Yes, this fulfills the requirement to return MIP65 Surplus to the SB on a recurring basis and ensures the liquidation process functions as designed. Ratification Poll for Onboarding Retro as CES-001 Facilitator (MIP41c4-SP40) - March 13, 2023 - Yes, based on the testimony of MakerDAO community members we see Retro as a good fit to take on a Facilitator role for CES. Ratification Poll for Phoenix Labs - Spark Lend Launch (SPF) (MIP55c3-SP16) - March 13, 2023 - Yes, we have previously supported efforts to set up Spark Lend and will continue to do so for this set of SPFs and want to see where Spark Lend develops. Ratification Poll for D3M to Spark Lend (MIP116) - March 13, 2023 - Yes, alongside the Spark Lend efforts we have been voting for, opening a D3M for them is part of initial commitment. Ratification Poll for Expand Facilitator Definition to Allow Entities (MIP4c2-SP34) - March 13, 2023 - Yes, we see no reason why Facilitators should only be individuals and can’t be e.g. LLCs. Ratification Poll for Risk Facilitator Onboarding (RISK-001) (MIP41c4-SP41) - March 13, 2023 - Yes, based on the recommendation from MonetSupply and Rema, we agree with this Risk Facilitator onboarding. Ratification Poll for Protocol Engineering Facilitator Onboarding (MIP41c4-SP42) - March 13, 2023 - Yes, along with our vote to have the Facilitator definition to expand to entities, we consider this facilitator onboarding a no-brainer. Ratification Poll for Starknet CU Budget Extension (SNE-001) (MIP14c2-SP4) - March 13, 2023 - Yes, we approve of the budget extension to the Starknet CU and consider the L2 efforts crucial for MakerDAO.

Ratification Poll for the Constitution MIP Set - March 13, 2023  No. After a long consideration of the Endgame Constitution MIP set, we are voting against it because we disagree with it as the best plan going forward and think the current path Maker is on is already a good path (with some possibilities for tweaks). Despite voting against the proposal, we will continue to work as delegates in Maker and view it not as a catastrophic change – if this is the direction MKR holders want we will accept it and try to push things in the right direction within Endgame. Our key worries with the proposed Endgame constitution and the future of where it might lead are:  Possibility to remove DAI from being pegged to USD. We view this as the most important product feature of DAI and do not see demand for a product that isn’t strongly tied to USD. This is only possible with USD-like collateral and accepting regulatory risk. Unclarity around MKR inflation and dilution to existing holders. It’s unclear how much this will exactly be and more crucially, how it will be distributed. In any case, existing MKR holders will be diluted and we think the proposed figures of 40-60k MKR per year are enormous. Additionally, we don’t think it’s Maker’s job to do public goods or charity funding i.e. the 20k MKR allocated to such activities. Ethereum is a public good but the protocol doesn’t have a charity element. Governance overhead. We don’t think the proposed governance mechanisms around e.g. committees will decrease bad incentives or overhead in the governance process. To us, these feel like overcomplicated mechanisms that bring bureaucracy. The goal should be to increase the amount of MKR delegated but we feel it’s the incentive of current delegates to not support this type of idea because it dilutes the voting power of every single current delegate. This Endgame vote will probably decrease the number of MKR that are actively voting within the ecosystem.     Despite the results of this vote, we are optimistic about the future of Maker and looking forward to working with the community on how we can improve on what we consider the worst parts of Endgame. We will continue the vote as objectively as possible for the long-term benefit of the average MKR holder. This is independent of the importance of the vote.
